text: Yes: I am a dreamer. For a dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Whenever a man does a thoroughly stupid thing, it is always from the noblest motives.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: To love oneself is the beginning of a life-long romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: When I was young I thought that money was the most important thing in life; now that I am old I know that it is.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Children begin by loving their parents; after a time they judge them; rarely, if ever, do they forgive them.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Never love anybody who treats you like you're ordinary.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The smallest act of kindness is worth more than the grandest intention.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I am sick of women who love one. Women who hate one are much more interesting.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Women are made to be loved, not understood.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Women defend themselves by attacking, just as they attack by sudden and strange surrenders.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Art is the most intense mode of individualism that the world has known.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Life imitates art far more than art imitates life.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Football is all very well as a game for rough girls, but is hardly suitable for delicate boys.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The heart was made to be broken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The critic has to educate the public; the artist has to educate the critic.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: You can never be overdressed or overeducated.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The true perfection of man lies not in what man has, but in what man is.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: After the first glass, you see things as you wish they were. After the second, you see things as they are not. Finally, you see things as they really are, and that is the most horrible thing in the world.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Ignorance is like a delicate fruit; touch it, and the bloom is gone.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Hearts live by being wounded.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relatives.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I choose my friends for their good looks, my acquaintances for their good characters, and my enemies for their good intellects.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Music is the art which is most nigh to tears and memory.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: If there was less sympathy in the world, there would be less trouble in the world.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A kiss may ruin a human life.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Crying is the refuge of plain women but the ruin of pretty ones.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A flower blossoms for its own joy.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: To give and not expect return, that is what lies at the heart of love.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Anybody can make history; only a great man can write it.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Young men want to be faithful, and are not; old men want to be faithless, and cannot.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There are only two kinds of people who are really fascinating: people who know absolutely everything, and people who know absolutely nothing.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The only real people are the people who never existed.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does. That's his.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: My great mistake, the fault for which I can't forgive myself is that one day I ceased my obstinate pursuit of my own individuality.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A man who does not think for himself does not think at all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Men always want to be a woman's first love. That is their clumsy vanity. We women have a more subtle instinct about things.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Men always want to be a woman's first love - women like to be a mans last romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: We are each our own devil, and we make this world our hell
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There are many things that we would throw away if we were not afraid that others might pick them up.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The condition of perfection is idleness: the aim of perfection is youth.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: To be natural is such a very difficult pose to keep up.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Death must be so beautiful. To lie in the soft brown earth, with the grasses waving above one's head, and listen to silence. To have no yesterday, and no to-morrow. To forget time, to forgive life, to be at peace.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The basis of optimism is sheer terror.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There are many things that we would throw away if we were not afraid that others might pick them up
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There is only one thing in life worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Every portrait that is painted with feeling is a portrait of the artist, not of the sitter.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A cigarette is the perfect type of a perfect pleasure. It is exquisite, and it leaves one unsatisfied.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Bad manners make a journalist.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: What seems to us as bitter trials are often blessings in disguise.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Mere color, unspoiled by meaning, and unallied with definite form, can speak to the soul in a thousand different ways.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: My great mistake, the fault for which I can't forgive myself, is that one day I ceased my obstinate pursuit of my own individuality.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The intellect is not a serious thing, and never has been. It is an instrument on which one plays, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Consistency is the last refuge of the unimaginative.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Seriousness is the only refuge of the shallow.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I think it's very healthy to spend time alone. You need to know how to be alone and not defined by another person.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There's this place in me where your fingerprints still rest, your kisses still linger, and your whispers softly echo.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Never love anybody that treats you like you're ordinary.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: No man is rich enough to buy back his past.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: No matter who broke your heart, or how long it takes to heal, you'll never get through it without your friends.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A red rose is not selfish because it wants to be a red rose. It would be horribly selfish if it wanted all the other flowers in the garden to be both red and roses.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: To lose one parent may be regarded as a misfortune... to lose both seems like carelessness.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The husbands of very beautiful women belong to the criminal classes.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A pessimist is somebody who complains about the noise when opportunity knocks.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: When one pays a visit it is for the purpose of wasting other people's time, not one's own.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The advantage of the emotions is that they lead us astray.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: When liberty comes with hands dabbled in blood it is hard to shake hands with her.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Literature always anticipates life. It does not copy it, but moulds it to its purpose.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Those who are faithful know only the trivial side of love: it is the faithless who know love's tragedies.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: If you are not too long, I will wait here for you all my life.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I adore simple pleasures. They are the last refuge of the complex.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Woman begins by resisting a man's advances and ends up blocking his retreat.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: My own business always bores me to death; I prefer other people's.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Good resolutions are simply checks that men draw on a bank where they have no account.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The old believe everything, the middle-aged suspect everything, the young know everything.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The modern sympathy with invalids is morbid. Illness of any kind is hardly a thing to be encouraged in others.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The sick do not ask if the hand that smoothes their pillow is pure, nor the dying care if the lips that touch their brow have known the kiss of sin.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The secret of life is to appreciate the pleasure of being terribly deceived.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Memory is the diary that we all carry about with us.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: It is perfectly monstrous the way people go about nowadays saying things against one, behind one's back, that are absolutely and entirely true.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: If one tells the truth, one is sure sooner or later to be found out
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Always borrow money from a pessimist. He won't expect it back.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Men always want to be a woman's first love. Women like to be a man's last romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: A true friend stabs you in the front.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I always like to know everything about my new friends, and nothing about my old ones.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Art is the only serious thing in the world. And the artist is the only person who is never serious.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: You don't love someone for their looks, or their clothes, or for their fancy car, but because they sing a song only you can hear.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The best way to appreciate your job is to imagine yourself without one.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I don't want to earn my living; I want to live.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Whenever life sucks, remember you're going to die someday.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: One should never trust a woman who tells her real age. If she tells that, she'll tell anything.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Patriotism is the virtue of the vicious.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There is nothing in the world like the devotion of a married woman. It is a thing no married man knows anything about.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: There are only two tragedies in life: one is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: As long as a woman can look ten years younger than her own daughter, she is perfectly satisfied.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: They spoil every romance by trying to make it last forever.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead. The consciousness of loving and being loved brings a warmth and a richness to life that nothing else can bring.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: It's beauty that captures your attention; personality that captures your heart.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The note of the perfect personality is not rebellion, but peace.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Nowadays, saying what you really think can be a serious error since one risks being misunderstood.
author: Oscar Wilde
